meanings.definition: To place (a dead body) in the ground or a tomb.
meanings.sent1: They buried their beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The family buried their grandfather in the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The kids buried their treasure in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were buried deep in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The secrets of the past were buried beneath the old oak tree.

meanings.definition: To cover (something) completely with a substance.
meanings.sent1: She buried the seeds in the soil to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The snowstorm buried the town under a thick blanket of snow.
meanings.sent3: The chef buried the strawberries in a mountain of whipped cream.
meanings.sent4: The avalanche buried the mountain climbers under tons of snow.
meanings.sent5: The artist buried the canvas in layers of vibrant paint.

meanings.sent1: He buried his feelings deep inside and never spoke about them.
meanings.sent2: The spy buried the classified documents in a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent3: The magician buried the coin under a stack of cards.
meanings.sent4: The truth was buried beneath layers of lies and deception.
meanings.sent5: She buried her face in her hands, trying to hide her embarrassment.
